skill.name: requesting-code-review
skill.description: Use when completing tasks, implementing major features, or before merging to verify work meets requirements - dispatches code-reviewer subagent to review implementation against plan or requirements before proceeding

skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code review prompt templates. No executable code, network operations, or filesystem access beyond its own files.

content.user_title: Request code review for quality verification
content.value_statement: Code issues caught early prevent costly fixes later. This skill dispatches a code-reviewer subagent to verify implementation against requirements before proceeding with development.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches code-reviewer subagent to analyze changes
Compares implementation against plan or requirements
Checks code quality, architecture, and testing coverage
Categorizes issues by severity: Critical, Important, Minor
Assesses production readiness with clear verdict
Provides specific file and line references for issues
limitations: Requires prepared git SHAs (BASE_SHA and HEAD_SHA)
Requires plan or requirements document to compare against
Subagent must have access to the codebase being reviewed
Does not automatically fix identified issues

use_cases.title: Task completion verification
use_cases.description: Review each completed task before moving to the next one to prevent issues from compounding

use_cases.title: Pre-merge quality gate
use_cases.description: Verify feature implementation meets requirements before merging code into main branch

use_cases.title: Fresh perspective debugging
use_cases.description: Get objective code review when stuck to identify issues and suggest solutions

prompt_templates.title: After task completion
prompt_templates.scenario: Task 2 completed, need review before Task 3
prompt_templates.prompt: Request code review for my implementation. WHAT: Added verification and repair functions. PLAN: Task 2 from docs/plans/deployment-plan.md. BASE_SHA: a7981ec HEAD_SHA: 3df7661. DESCRIPTION: Added verifyIndex() and repairIndex() with 4 issue types.

prompt_templates.title: Before merge to main
prompt_templates.prompt: Full code review before merge. WHAT: User authentication module with JWT tokens. REQUIREMENTS: See RFC-001-auth.md. DIFF: Compare origin/main to current HEAD. Provide critical, important, and minor issues with file references.

prompt_templates.title: Complex bug fix review
prompt_templates.scenario: Fixed a difficult bug, want verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my bug fix for memory leak in connection pool. WHAT: Added proper cleanup in finally blocks, fixed async handling. DIFF: Compare HEAD~1 to HEAD. Focus on resource management and edge cases.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring baseline
prompt_templates.scenario: About to refactor, want pre-refactor snapshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Review current state before refactoring. WHAT: Database layer abstraction. PLAN: docs/plans/refactor-db.md. Get baseline assessment of current architecture and test coverage so we can compare after refactor.

output_examples.input: Request code review for my user authentication module
output: Strengths: Clean separation of concerns with auth middleware (auth.ts:15-42). Comprehensive test coverage for 8 authentication flows. Good error handling with specific error types.
Important: Missing rate limiting on login endpoint (security concern). No password reset flow documented in requirements.
Minor: Consider extracting JWT signing to separate utility. Inconsistent error message format across modules.
Assessment: Ready to merge with fixes. Core implementation is solid. Important issues should be addressed before production use.

best_practices: Review after each task in subagent-driven development to catch issues early
Always provide the plan or requirements document for comparison
Act on feedback proportionally: Critical issues immediately, Important before proceeding, Minor noted for later
anti_patterns: Skipping review because code 'looks simple' - simple code can still have bugs
Proceeding with unfixed Important issues that could cascade into bigger problems
Ignoring valid technical feedback without providing counter-evidence

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code. The code-reviewer subagent also uses git commands to analyze code changes.

faq.question: What git information do I need?
faq.answer: You need BASE_SHA (starting commit) and HEAD_SHA (ending commit). Get them with git rev-parse or git log.

faq.question: How long does review take?
faq.answer: Reviews complete in seconds to minutes depending on diff size. Large changes take longer to review thoroughly.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only analyzes code locally using git diff. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the review?
faq.answer: Push back with technical reasoning and evidence. The skill encourages disputing feedback you believe is incorrect.

faq.question: How is this different from IDE code review?
faq.answer: This skill provides holistic review against requirements and architecture. IDE tools focus on syntax and style. Use both for comprehensive quality.
